message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is about using convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for lesion detection in CT scans. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a new method for incorporating 3D context information, which involves aggregating feature maps of 2D images, so it is likely to be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper involves developing a universal lesion detector, which suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also uses the DeepLesion dataset, which is a medical imaging dataset, so it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper involves training the network end-to-end, which suggests that it may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
